growthPercentiles.title: Growth Percentiles

bloodPressure.description: Evaluate blood pressure readings based on age, height, and gender

heartRate.description: Analyze heart rate ranges by age and clinical context

bilirubin.description: Calculate risk levels for neonatal hyperbilirubinemia

bmi.description: Body Mass Index calculation and percentile tracking

headCircumference.title: Head Circumference
headCircumference.description: Track head circumference measurements and percentiles

lab.title: Lab Reference
lab.description: Interpret pediatric lab values with age-based reference ranges.

premiumFeatures.title: Premium Features
features: PDF report generation with your branding

who.name: WHO Growth Standard
who.description: International standards for optimal growth (breastfed children from multiple countries)
who.details: Recommended by WHO for international use

cdc_infant.name: CDC Growth (Infant)
cdc_infant.description: U.S. reference charts for tracking infant growth and development
cdc_infant.details: Based on U.S. national survey data

cdc_child.name: CDC Growth (Child)
cdc_child.description: Standard U.S. pediatric growth charts for children and teens
cdc_child.details: Most widely used in U.S. clinical practice

intergrowth.name: INTERGROWTH-21st
intergrowth.description: International standards for newborn growth assessment
intergrowth.details: Optimal for early postnatal growth monitoring

standardChange.title: Recommended Standard Change
standardChange.description: Based on the patient's age, we recommend using the {standard} standard.

savePrompt.title: Save Measurements?
savePrompt.description: Would you like to save these measurements to {name}'s records?

required.dob: Date of birth is required for non-intergrowth standards
required.measurement: Measurement date is required for non-intergrowth standards
required.gestWeeks: Gestational weeks is required for Intergrowth
required.gestDays: Gestational days is required for Intergrowth

errors.measurementBeforeBirth: Measurement date cannot be before birth date
errors.measurementAfterBirth: Measurement date must be after birth date

dataSources.title: Data source
dataSources.cdc_child: United States CDC Growth Charts (ages 2 to 20)
dataSources.cdc_infant: United States CDC Growth Charts (ages 0 to 36 months)

BloodPressureCalculator.title: Blood Pressure Calculator
BloodPressureCalculator.description: Calculate pediatric blood pressure percentiles using 2017 AAP guidelines (Ages 1 year - 17 years)

validation.heightInvalid: Please enter a valid height in cm
validation.systolicRange: Systolic BP must be between 50-250 mmHg
validation.diastolicRange: Diastolic BP must be between 30-150 mmHg
validation.systolicHigher: Systolic BP must be higher than diastolic BP
validation.ageRange: Patient age must be between 1 and 17 years at the time of measurement.

startHere.title: Start Here
startHere.description: Please select both a date of birth and a date of measurement to begin.

invalidAge.title: Invalid Age Range
invalidAge.description: Please select a date of birth and measurement date so that the patient is between 1 and 17 years old at the time of measurement.

invalidBP.title: Invalid Blood Pressure
invalidBP.description: Systolic pressure must be higher than diastolic pressure. Current: {systolic}/{diastolic} - Please check your values.

bpFormat.title: Blood Pressure Format:
bpFormat.systolic: Systolic (top number): Pressure when heart beats
bpFormat.diastolic: Diastolic (bottom number): Pressure when heart rests

ageDisplay.label: Age:
ageDisplay.warning: Calculator is designed for ages 1 year - 17 years (12-215 months)

dataSource.whoHeight: Height percentiles use WHO growth standards for ages 1–2 years.
dataSource.cdcHeight: Height percentiles use CDC growth charts for ages 2–17 years.

clinicalInterpretation.title: Clinical Interpretation
clinicalInterpretation.classification: Classification: Based on the higher percentile (systolic: {systolic}%, diastolic: {diastolic}%)
clinicalInterpretation.heightAdjustment: Height adjustment: Applied based on {height}th percentile height

referenceRanges.title: Reference Ranges for Age {age} ({gender})
referenceRanges.note: These are approximate values based on 50th percentile height. Actual thresholds adjust for individual height percentile.

footer.reference: Reference: 2017 American Academy of Pediatrics Clinical Practice Guideline
footer.note: Note: Uses 2017 AAP screening table with quantile regression approximation

normal.description: {description} - Blood pressure is within normal range

elevated.systolicReason: Your child's systolic pressure is elevated.
elevated.diastolicReason: Your child's diastolic pressure is elevated.

patientSelected.title: Patient Selected
patientSelected.description: {name} has been selected for the consultation

patientRemoved.title: Patient Removed
patientRemoved.description: Patient has been removed from the consultation

Footer.title: Footer
Footer.description: Making pediatric calculations easier and more accurate for healthcare professionals.

table.title: Patient List

Appointments.title: Appointments
Appointments.subtitle: Manage patient appointments and schedule
Appointments.newAppointmentDescription: Schedule a new appointment with a patient
Appointments.viewingAppointments: View and manage appointments for the selected period
Appointments.noAvailabilityDescription: You haven't set up your availability schedule yet. Patients won't be able to book appointments until you define your available time slots.

settings.title: Manage Availability
settings.subtitle: Configure your availability and appointment slots
settings.availabilityDescription: Set your recurring availability and schedule exceptions
settings.weeklyScheduleDescription: Configure your regular working hours for each day of the week
settings.exceptionsDescription: Configure specific dates where your availability differs from the normal schedule

weekly.description: Set your regular weekly availability schedule. This will be used to generate appointment slots for patients to book.
weekly.noBreaks: No breaks added. You are available all day.
weekly.startBeforeEnd: Start time must be before end time.
weekly.endAfterStart: End time must be after start time.
weekly.noAvailableTimeSlot: No available time slot for a break. All possible time slots are already taken.

daySchedule.noBreaks: No breaks added. Available all day.

breakManager.noBreaksAdded: No breaks added. You are available all day.

cannotAddBreak.title: Cannot Add Break
cannotAddBreak.description: No available time slot for a break. All possible time slots are already taken.

invalidBreakTime.title: Invalid Break Time
invalidBreakTime.startBeforeEnd: Start time must be before end time.
invalidBreakTime.endAfterStart: End time must be after start time.

validationErrors.title: Validation Errors
validationErrors.fixErrorsBeforeSaving: Please fix the validation errors before saving.

warnings.title: Availability Warnings
warnings.confirmProceed: There are warnings with your availability settings. Are you sure you want to proceed?

exceptions.description: Manage your availability by blocking specific dates, setting custom hours, or blocking individual time slots.
exceptions.notWorkingDay: This day is not part of your regular working schedule
exceptions.clickToToggle: Click on a slot to toggle its availability

availabilityUpdated.title: Availability Updated
availabilityUpdated.description: Your weekly availability schedule has been saved correctly.

exceptionsUpdated.title: Exceptions Updated
exceptionsUpdated.description: Your date and time exceptions have been saved correctly.

cancel.title: Cancel Appointment
cancel.description: Are you sure you want to cancel this appointment? This action cannot be undone.

updateStatus.title: Update Appointment Status
updateStatus.description: Choose the new status for this appointment.

Appointments.noAppointments: No appointments scheduled for this day

cdc.description: U.S. reference BMI percentiles for children and teens
cdc.details: Most widely used in U.S. clinical practice

validation.selectDob: Please select a Date of Birth to enter measurements
validation.whoAgeError: WHO BMI Standard is only valid for 0-24 months.
validation.cdcAgeError: CDC BMI Standard is only valid for 2ars (24-240 months).

invalidStandard.title: Invalid Standard for Age
invalidStandard.description: The selected standard is not valid for the patient's age.

DoseCalculator.title: Dose Calculator
DoseCalculator.subtitle: Select a dosing method and calculate medication dosages based on patient parameters

weight.name: Weight-based
weight.details: Based only on patient weight, note: Most common pediatric dosing method

bsa.name: BSA-based
bsa.note: Used for chemotherapy and high-risk medications

bsa_normalized.name: BSA-normalized
bsa_normalized.details: Uses total BSA, normalized to standard adult BSA

LabCalculator.noResults: Please enter lab values and patient information to see results.
LabCalculator.basicPlan: Basic plan includes common lab tests. Upgrade to Premium for complete Harriet Lane reference dataset with 200+ specialized tests.
LabCalculator.patientInfoHint: Enter patient information to calculate age-appropriate reference ranges for lab values.
LabCalculator.disclaimerText: Values are commonly accepted reference ranges compiled from multiple sources. Patient-specific goals may differ depending on age, sex, clinical condition, and laboratory methodology used. Always consult with a healthcare professional for interpretation of laboratory results.
LabCalculator.valuesAreCommonlyAcceptedReferenceRanges: Values are commonly accepted reference ranges
LabCalculator.dependingOnAgeSexClinicalConditionAndLab: depending on age, sex, clinical condition, and laboratory methodology used
LabCalculator.alwaysConsultWithAHealthcareProfessional: Always consult with a healthcare professional for interpretation of laboratory results

BilirubinCalculator.title: Bilirubin Thresholds Calculator
BilirubinCalculator.description: Assess hyperbilirubinemia and determine phototherapy need for newborns ≥35 weeks gestation (AAP 2022).

dateTimeRequired.birth: Date and time of birth are required
dateTimeRequired.measurement: Date and time of measurement are required

bilirubinValidation.tooHigh: Bilirubin level seems too high. Please verify the value (normal range: 0.1-30 mg/dL)
bilirubinValidation.tooLow: Bilirubin level seems too low. Please verify the value (minimum: 0.1 mg/dL)

timeValidation.measurementAfterBirth: Measurement time must be after birth time
timeValidation.ageRange: Age at measurement must be between 12 and 336 hours (14 days). AAP 2022 guidelines do not provide data outside this range.

tooYoung.title: Age too young:
tooYoung.description: The baby is only {hours} hours old. AAP 2022 guidelines only provide recommendations for babies ≥12 hours old. Please wait until the baby is at least 12 hours old before using this calculator.

tooOld.title: Age too old:
tooOld.description: The baby is {hours} hours old ({days} days). AAP 2022 guidelines only provide recommendations up to 336 hours (14 days) of age. Please consult with a pediatrician for babies older than 14 days.

validAge.description: Calculated age at time of measurement: {hours} hours.

interventions.confirmTSB: If using TcB, confirm with TSB?

urgentExchangeTransfusion.title: URGENT - Exchange Transfusion
urgentExchangeTransfusion.description: Consult neonatologist immediately. Continue intensive phototherapy.

escalationRequired.title: Escalation Required
escalationRequired.description: Intensive phototherapy. Consider neonatology consult. Recheck in 4-6h.

startPhototherapy.title: Start Phototherapy
startPhototherapy.description: Begin immediately. Monitor hydration. Recheck in 12-24h.

closeMonitoring.title: Close Monitoring
closeMonitoring.description: Approaching threshold. Recheck in 12-24h or if clinical concerns.

routineCare.title: Routine Care
routineCare.description: Levels acceptable. Continue standard newborn care.

riskFactorAlert.title: Risk Factors Present
riskFactorAlert.description: Consider lower intervention thresholds and increased monitoring frequency.

chart.title: Bilirubin Thresholds
chart.patientInfo: @ {hours} hours | GA: {weeks} weeks | Neurotox risk factors: {riskFactors}
chart.dataSource: Based on AAP 2022 Clinical Practice Guidelines for Hyperbilirubinemia
